00041 #ifndef _USB_DEVICE_TASK_H_
00042 #define _USB_DEVICE_TASK_H_
00043 
00044 //! @defgroup usb_device_task USB device task
00045 //! @{

00056 //!
00057 //! Public : (bit) usb_suspended
00058 //! usb_suspended is set to TRUE when USB is in suspend mode
00059 //! usb_suspended is set to FALSE otherwise
00060 //!/
00061 extern bit   usb_suspended;
00062 
00063 
00064 //!
00065 //! @brief Definitions of B-Device states
00066 //!
00067 #define B_IDLE              0
00068 #define B_SRP_INIT          1
00069 #define B_PERIPHERAL        2
00070 #define B_WAIT_ACON         3
00071 #define B_HOST              4
00072 #define B_END_HNP_SUSPEND   5
00073 
00074 //!
00075 //! @brief OTG B-Device SRP protocole specific states or events
00076 //!
00077 extern  U8  otg_device_sessions;
00078 extern  U8  otg_b_device_state;
00079 extern U8  sof_seen_in_session;
00080 
00081   //!  Is the current session a result of a SRP ?
00082 #define Start_session_with_srp()          (otg_device_sessions |= 0x01)
00083 #define End_session_with_srp()            (otg_device_sessions &= ~0x01)
00084 #define Is_session_started_with_srp()     (((otg_device_sessions&0x01) != 0) ? TRUE : FALSE)
00085 
00086   //! Has a SRP been sent, and waiting for an answer
00087 #define Srp_sent_and_waiting_answer()     (otg_device_sessions |= 0x02)
00088 #define Ack_srp_sent_and_answer()         (otg_device_sessions &= ~0x02)
00089 #define Is_srp_sent_and_waiting_answer()  (((otg_device_sessions&0x02) != 0) ? TRUE : FALSE)
00090 
00091   //! Is the Tb_Srp counter enabled ? Cleared by timer if Tb_Srp_Fail elapsed
00092 //! Tb_Srp_Fail must be between 5 and 6 sec. With an interrupt routine executed each 2ms, its value becomes 2500 (used:5.2sec)
00093 #define TB_SRP_FAIL_MIN       0x0A28
00094 extern  U16  otg_tb_srp_cpt;
00095 #define Init_tb_srp_counter()             (otg_tb_srp_cpt = 0)
00096 #define Is_tb_srp_counter_overflow()      ((otg_tb_srp_cpt > TB_SRP_FAIL_MIN) ? TRUE : FALSE)
00097 
00098 
00099 //!
00100 //! @brief This function initializes the USB device controller.
00101 //!
00102 //! This function enables the USB controller and init the USB interrupts.
00103 //! The aim is to allow the USB connection detection in order to send
00104 //! the appropriate USB event to the operating mode manager.
00105 //!
00106 //!
00107 //! @param none
00108 //!
00109 //! @return none
00110 //!
00111 void usb_device_task_init     (void);
00112 
00113 //!
00114 //! @brief This function initializes the USB device controller
00115 //!
00116 //! This function enables the USB controller and init the USB interrupts.
00117 //! The aim is to allow the USB connection detection in order to send
00118 //! the appropriate USB event to the operating mode manager.
00119 //! Start device function is executed once VBUS connection has been detected
00120 //! either by the VBUS change interrupt either by the VBUS high level
00121 //!
00122 //! @param none
00123 //!
00124 //! @return none
00125 //!
00126 void usb_start_device  (void);
00127 
00128 //! @brief Entry point of the USB device mamagement
00129 //!
00130 //! This function is the entry point of the USB management. Each USB
00131 //! event is checked here in order to launch the appropriate action.
00132 //! If a Setup request occurs on the Default Control Endpoint,
00133 //! the usb_process_request() function is call in the usb_standard_request.c file
00134 //!
00135 //! @param none
00136 //!
00137 //! @return none
00138 void usb_device_task   (void);
00139 
00140 //! @}
00141 
00142 #endif /* _USB_DEVICE_TASK_H_ */
